name: Congenital Erythropoietic Porphyria with Secondary Hemochromatosis
chief_complaint: My child's skin blisters easily in sunlight and their urine is dark red.
physical_findings: Fragile blistering skin on sun-exposed areas
treatment: Strict sunlight avoidance with protective clothing
prognosis: Guarded. Progressive disease with risk of liver failure and complications from chronic hemolysis. Early HSCT may improve outcomes.
description: An ultra-rare autosomal recessive disorder of heme biosynthesis causing accumulation of non-physiologic porphyrin isomers. The condition leads to cutaneous photosensitivity, chronic hemolytic anemia, and secondary iron overload from repeated transfusions and ineffective erythropoiesis.
multiple_choice: Congenital Erythropoietic Porphyria with Secondary Hemochromatosis
